title: fish_completion: fix use of `tac`
body:
hopefully this is more portable. I have no clue how it works.

Fixes #1485

title: tasks: fix project_root when using .config/mise.toml or .mise/config.toml
body: Fixes #1480

title: tasks: only show select if no task specified
plugins: improve post-plugin-update script
body:
* only call it if the plugin was actually updated
* set the ASDF_PLUGIN_PREV_REF and ASDF_PLUGIN_POST_REF env vars

title: use mise to get development dependencies
tasks: fix config_root path
body: Fixes #1469

title: tasks: support array of commands directly
body: Fixes #1385

title: allow using templates in task files
body: Fixes #1469

title: rename internal MISE_BIN env var to __MISE_BIN
body: Fixes #1467

title: remove dirs_next in favor of simpler "home" crate
body: home is an official rust crate we were already using

title: add support for installing directly with go modules
body:
This mimics the NPM/Cargo functionality for Go install.

Things you should look at:
1. is that the best way to get Go into the build/test process?
2. should I be only installing the binary into the rtx path or moving the whole gopath like I am currently? The whole GOPATH benefits sandboxing I guess but would almost definitely result in duplication of libraries across similar project installs. Could alternatively set GOBIN and do an mkdir of the /bin inside the version folder.

Things I noticed while contributing:
- docs on *running* mise or tests without the devcontainer are sparse at best, couldn't figure out how to deactivate mise enough to satisfy the tests
- perhaps an option to run tests in a container would be good? Maybe stepchowfun/toast or earthly or similar?
- It is also pretty hard to wipe a messed up package install, or at least undocumented.
- you mention something about a shim in CONTRIBUTING.md, but I couldn't figure out how this was meant to work it seems like not all the info required to set it up
- pre commit hooks don't work without some md-magic thing I don't have installed

title: fix: always load global configs
body: Fix/followup to #1462. Global/system configuration is not ignored anymore if `current_dir` fails.

title: fix not_found handler when command start with "--"
body: if you type something like "--profile" in you would get a strange error

title: fix: no panic on missing current dir
body:
The shell is spammed with a panic message after each command if the current directory is not available, with this PR simply mise ignores/logs if that is the case instead of a hard crash.

I noticed the issue while browsing a remote snapshot directory tree that was FUSE mounted by [kopia](https://github.com/kopia/kopia).

title: fix: bail out of task suggestion if there are no tasks
body: we should probably `bail` if the user is in a directory with no taks defined

title: feat: add interactive selection for tasks if task was not found
body:
Adds an interactive task selector as mentioned in #1274.

- adds cask `inquire`
- replaces `task not found` error with interactive selection of available tasks

Did not find an easy way to test this. Not sure if theres an easy way send user input to the console.

title: feat: add completions for task deps command
body: @jdx Forgot to add the completions for the new `task deps` command 🙄

title: skip slow cargo test if TEST_ALL is not set
added support for installing directly from npm
body: e.g.: `mise use -g npm-prettier@3.2.0`

title: support for installing directly from cargo
body: e.g.: `mise use -g cargo-eza@latest`

title: added "forge" infra
body: This makes it possible to have other backends like cargo or npm

title: Revert "miette (#1368)"
body:
This reverts commit 332648d5283fa5b6984426919d2fe964df813a58.

It turns out miette doesn't support backtrace's on normal errors. Kind of a dealbreaker for me unfortunately. I may see if I can add it back in just for config parsing since it is definitely really cool.

title: Update nushell.rs - Add explicit spread
body:
Running mise with nushell in the latest release of nushell (currently [0.89.0](https://www.nushell.sh/blog/2024-01-09-nushell_0_89_0.html#spread-operator-for-commands)) results in the following warning:

```shell
Error:   × Automatically spreading lists is deprecated
    ╭─[/hREDACTED:35:1]
 35 │   } else {
 36 │     ^"rtx" $command $rest
    ·                     ──┬──
    ·                       ╰── Spreading lists automatically when calling external commands is deprecated and will be removed in 0.91.
 37 │   }
    ╰────
  help: Use the spread operator (put a '...' before the argument)
```

This change fixes the warning.

title: feat: add command to print task dependency tree
body:
First rough draft to visualize task depencies (#1272).

_Changes_
- moved `Deps` to `tasks/deps.rs` and made crate/struct public
- added new `task` command `deps [--dot] [TASKS]...`
- uses crate `ptree` to render  a tree directly from a `petgraph::Graph`
- uses crate `petgraph` to render a DOT representation which can be piped via `| dot -Tpng > ./graph.png`

_Open issues_
- [tree] ptree does not seem to allow customization of output and simply uses `fmt::Display` which currently has the format `[TASK] CMD...`
- [tree] sub-tasks seem to be in wrong order
- [dot] only renders nodes with incoming edges

Looking forward to some comments, as a Rust newby i feel there is a lot of room for improvement in that first rough draft.

title: settings: read from config.toml
body:
Fixes #1436

Moving to `settings.toml` was a regretful mistake. It turns out that having 2 config files in a CLI is just a bad idea. It's confusing to users and ultimately wasn't even necessary so we're going back to 1 file.

Sorry for the musical chairs here. I know breaking changes like that are not great and especially when they get _reverted_ it would be especially maddening. Moving back, however, should not be a breaking change.

We've taken steps to correct this from a project management perspective by setting up an advisory board: https://mise.jdx.dev/team.html You can certainly expect fewer abrupt changes in the future. A group of people able to review decisions like this before I roll out a change is exactly what this project needed.

We've gone through this together and came up with a plan to get us off of having `settings.toml` and back to `config.toml` in a way that should involve minimal disruption—in fact I think it's possible nobody may even notice this change.

This change should not negatively impact anyone. mise will read from both files and merge the contents, preferring `config.toml`. You can continue to use `settings.toml` and not change a thing. In a few weeks, I'm going to roll out another change to silently merge the contents of `settings.toml` into `config.toml`. If you'd like to stay ahead of that, go ahead and put the contents of `settings.toml` back into `config.toml` like before and nothing will change for you.

I really am sorry for this one. I should've been a lot more careful rolling out the initial change to split these files up. Just know that we've definitely taken some steps to correct that.

title: Fix missing ASDF_PLUGIN_PATH environment variable
body: Some ASDF scripts need ASDF_PLUGIN_PATH to reference patches or other scripts. For compatibility, it is added to the environment variables provided to executed plugin scripts.

title: env-vars: improvements
body:
* Use ui::table for better formatting
* Allow viewing a single env var with `mise ev FOO`
* Added --global flag
* renamed to "set" (alias for `env-vars`, `ev` remains)
* Added `mise unset` command

See #1432

title: python: do not panic if precompiled arch/os is not supported
body: just use python-build to compile in this case

title: python: fix some precompiled issues
body:
Fixes #1430
Fixes #1411

title: fix(python): fixes #1419
body:
This commit fixes following issues.
- python default packages are not installed when installing precompiled python (#1419)
- `get_virtualenv()` is not performed when installing precompiled python.
- typo in warning message when installing precompiled python.

title: disallow [settings] header in settings.toml
body:
Before this would silently ignore everything in the file.

Fixes https://github.com/jdx/mise/issues/1403

title: allow expanding "~" for trusted_config_paths
body: Fixes https://github.com/jdx/mise/issues/1402

title: handle 404s
body: Fixes #1406

title: prevent adding relative/empty paths during activation
body:
attempting to address #1380

After some initial reading/testing, this seems to fix the problematic cases I found, and hopefully the test is helpful.

Also, because the behavior was a bit non-obvious to me, a link to some is_relative() examples

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=e806075e086f5d669ae4dfc0f0b40aa9

title: add path separator
body: found while testing in the dev container

title: Correct PATH for python venvs
body: Try to fix #1394

title: loosen regex for runtime symlink generation
body:
this makes it possible to do the following:

```sh
$ mise alias set java corretto-17 corretto-17
$ mise install java@corretto-17
$ ~/.local/share/mise/installs/java/corretto-17/bin/javac --version
javac 17.0.9
```

With that alias in place, mise will generate just one symlink for it. We could also add aliases for java directly to the core plugin like we do for [node](https://github.com/jdx/mise/blob/main/src/plugins/core/node.rs#L254-L274).

title: fix: nix flake build errors
body:
Thank you for your awesome project. This tool is so powerful for me.

I've added some patches to fix build errors on nix flake.

### Details

- fix nix flake (fc0534ce9b7cbb3da3fb5a4698b82c71ee3f1822)
  -  update lockfile (because rustc 1.70.0 or newer is required)
  - resolve OpenSSL error on build
  - fix a test to pass because of bash path in `test/cwd/.mise/tasks/filetask`
- add cargo crates required for tests  (9a4547b93d465b38198ee10ecec9d9a0c294b102)

### Tests

- [x] pass `nix build`
- [x] pass `nix develop`

title: python: add support for precompiled binaries
body: requires `experimental=1` for now

title: added paranoid setting
body: Fixes #500

title: fix(java): enable macOS integration hint for Zulu distribution
body:
Currently the macOS integration hint is not shown for Zulu distributions since the archive does not contain the `/Contents` folder in the root directory but within a `zulu-{major}.jdk` directory.

We can simply symlink that directory and then check for a `/Contents` directory in the installation root to show the hint for all vendors that support the integration.

title: fixed config load order
body: Fixes #1376

title: Add `description` to task object in JSON schema
body: Support tasks with a `description` key in the definition. This allows configs with a description to be validated correctly.

title: show better error when attemping to install core plugin
tasks: set --interleaved if graph is linear
tasks: set CLICOLOR_FORCE=1 and FORCE_COLOR=1
body:
if colors are enabled, make sure we keep them in sub-processes

Partial fix for #1290

title: env: use `mise.file`/`mise.path` config
body:
This renames the env_file and env_path config vars.

Fixes #1300

title: logging: prevent loading multiple times
body: Fixes #1351

title: not-found: use "[" instead of "test"
body:
This did not have any technical issues except in the edge-case where the user overrides "test" such as having alias test="...". It's highly unlikely someone would do this with "[".

See https://github.com/jdx/mise/discussions/1338#discussioncomment-8014200

title: fix(arch): remove comma from conflicts
body:
The comma is causing issues when installing `mise`:
```
:: (1/1) Parsing SRCINFO: mise
==> ERROR: conflicts contains invalid characters: ','
 -> error making: mise-exit status 12
 -> Failed to install the following packages. Manual intervention is required:
mise - exit status 12
```

Note: `mise-bin` is ok.

title: Update README.md to link to rtx page
body: Found it somewhat confusing on how [rtx got renamed to mise](https://github.com/jdx/mise/issues/1350) and what the migration path is.  https://mise.jdx.dev/rtx.html page answers a lot of my questions.  Might be helpful for others as well.

title: fix ssh urls
body: This bans plugin names with ":" in them but that _probably_ wouldn't have worked anyways.

title: updated demo.gif
body: Fixes #1347

title: Add additional conflicts
body:
Fixes for #1344 

when testing the previous change I was expecting to to prompt me to remove `rtx` with the following changes it did so.

I had `rtx-bin` installed and build the `miso-bin` package locally using `DRY_RUN=1 ./scripts/scripts/release-aur-bin.sh` and then running `makepkg` installing the artifact using `yay`.

```
malachi@pulsar aur-bin $ yay -U mise-bin-2024.1.3-1-x86_64.pkg.tar.zst 
loading packages...
resolving dependencies...
looking for conflicting packages...
:: mise-bin and rtx-bin are in conflict. Remove rtx-bin? [y/N] y

Package (2)  Old Version  New Version  Net Change

rtx-bin      2024.0.0-1                -15.84 MiB
mise-bin                  2024.1.3-1    15.83 MiB

Total Installed Size:  15.83 MiB
Net Upgrade Size:      -0.01 MiB

:: Proceed with installation? [Y/n] 
```

Feels a bit convuluted mentioning all varations of what it conlifcts with but I guess it's complete :)

title: aur: add "replaces" field
body:
Fixes #1344
cc @inverse

title: fix(java): use tar.gz archives to enable symlink support
body: IMO easiest fix for #1329 would be to only support `tar.gz` for now. It seems all vendors ship archives in this format which also seems to support symlinks properly as opposed to ZIP (rs-zip).

title: use: fix MISE_ASDF_COMPAT=1
body: Fixes #1337

title: chore(deps): update stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action action to v5
body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action) | action | major | `v4` -> `v5` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action (stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action)</summary>

### [`v5`](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v500---2023-10-06)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/compare/v4...v5)

New major release that bumps the default runtime to Node 20. There are no other breaking changes.

##### Changed

-   Update node version to node20 ([#​300](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/300)) [@​ryudaitakai](https://togithub.com/@​ryudaitakai)
-   Add \_log and \_set_github_output functions ([#​273](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/273)) [@​stefanzweifel](https://togithub.com/@​stefanzweifel)

##### Fixed

-   Seems like there is an extra space ([#​288](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/288)) [@​pedroamador](https://togithub.com/@​pedroamador)
-   Fix git-auto-commit.yml ([#​277](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/277)) [@​zcong1993](https://togithub.com/@​zcong1993)

##### Dependency Updates

-   Bump actions/checkout from 3 to 4 ([#​302](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/302)) [@​dependabot](https://togithub.com/@​dependabot)
-   Bump bats from 1.9.0 to 1.10.0 ([#​293](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/293)) [@​dependabot](https://togithub.com/@​dependabot)
-   Bump github/super-linter from 4 to 5 ([#​289](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/289)) [@​dependabot](https://togithub.com/@​dependabot)
-   Bump bats from 1.8.2 to 1.9.0 ([#​282](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action/pull/282)) [@​dependabot](https://togithub.com/@​dependabot)

</details>

title: chore: Configure Renovate
body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) Welcome to [Renovate](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/renovate)! This is an onboarding PR to help you understand and configure settings before regular Pull Requests begin. 🚦 To activate Renovate, merge this Pull Request. To disable Renovate, simply close this Pull Request unmerged. --- ### Detected Package Files * `.tool-versions` (asdf) * `Cargo.toml` (cargo) * `.devcontainer/Dockerfile` (dockerfile) * `packaging/alpine/Dockerfile` (dockerfile) * `packaging/deb/Dockerfile` (dockerfile) * `packaging/github-actions/Dockerfile` (dockerfile) * `packaging/rpm/Dockerfile` (dockerfile) * `packaging/rtx/Dockerfile` (dockerfile) * `.github/workflows/docker.yml` (github-actions) * `.github/workflows/mega-linter.yml` (github-actions) * `.github/workflows/release.yml` (github-actions) * `.github/workflows/test-plugins.yml` (github-actions) * `.github/workflows/test.yml` (github-actions) * `.node-version` (nodenv) * `e2e/.node-version` (nodenv) * `e2e/config/.node-version` (nodenv) * `e2e/config/pyproject.toml` (poetry) ### Configuration Summary Based on the default config's presets, Renovate will: - Start dependency updates only once this onboarding PR is merged - Show all Merge Confidence badges for pull requests. - Enable Renovate Dependency Dashboard creation. - Use semantic commit type `fix` for dependencies and `chore` for all others if semantic commits are in use. - Ignore `node_modules`, `bower_components`, `vendor` and various test/tests directories. - Group known monorepo packages together. - Use curated list of recommended non-monorepo package groupings. - Apply crowd-sourced package replacement rules. - Apply crowd-sourced workarounds for known problems with packages. 🔡 Do you want to change how Renovate upgrades your dependencies? Add your custom config to `renovate.json` in this branch. Renovate will update the Pull Request description the next time it runs. --- ### What to Expect With your current configuration, Renovate will create 16 Pull Requests:
fix(deps): update rust crate indexmap to 2.1 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/indexmap-2.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [indexmap](https://togithub.com/bluss/indexmap) to `2.1`
fix(deps): update rust crate num_cpus to 1.16 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/num_cpus-1.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [num_cpus](https://togithub.com/seanmonstar/num_cpus) to `1.16`
fix(deps): update rust crate once_cell to 1.19 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/once_cell-1.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [once_cell](https://togithub.com/matklad/once_cell) to `1.19`
fix(deps): update rust crate regex to 1.10 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/regex-1.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [regex](https://togithub.com/rust-lang/regex) to `1.10`
fix(deps): update rust crate reqwest to 0.11.23 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/reqwest-0.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [reqwest](https://togithub.com/seanmonstar/reqwest) to `0.11.23`
fix(deps): update rust crate tempfile to 3.9.0 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/tempfile-3.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [tempfile](https://togithub.com/Stebalien/tempfile) to `3.9.0`
fix(deps): update rust crate url to 2.5 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/url-2.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [url](https://togithub.com/servo/rust-url) to `2.5`
chore(deps): update dependency node to v20.10.0 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/node-20.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [node](https://togithub.com/nodejs/node) to `20.10.0`
chore(deps): update dependency shfmt to v1.3.1 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/shfmt-1.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [shfmt](https://togithub.com/mvdan/sh) to `1.3.1`
chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v4 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/actions-checkout-4.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [actions/checkout](https://togithub.com/actions/checkout) to `v4`
chore(deps): update actions/download-artifact action to v4 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/actions-download-artifact-4.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [actions/download-artifact](https://togithub.com/actions/download-artifact) to `v4`
chore(deps): update actions/upload-artifact action to v4 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/actions-upload-artifact-4.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [actions/upload-artifact](https://togithub.com/actions/upload-artifact) to `v4`
chore(deps): update dependency shfmt to v3 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/shfmt-3.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [shfmt](https://togithub.com/mvdan/sh) to `3.7.0`
chore(deps): update fedora docker tag to v40 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/fedora-40.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade fedora to `40`
chore(deps): update mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/rust docker tag to v1 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/mcr.microsoft.com-devcontainers-rust-1.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/rust to `1-1-bullseye`
chore(deps): update stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action action to v5 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/stefanzweifel-git-auto-commit-action-5.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action](https://togithub.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action) to `v5`

🚸 Branch creation will be limited to maximum 2 per hour, so it doesn't swamp any CI resources or overwhelm the project. See docs for `prhourlylimit` for details. --- ❓ Got questions? Check out Renovate's [Docs](https://docs.renovatebot.com/), particularly the Getting Started section. If you need any further assistance then you can also [request help here](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/renovate/discussions). --- This PR has been generated by [Mend Renovate](https://www.mend.io/free-developer-tools/renovate/). View repository job log [here](https://developer.mend.io/github/jdx/rtx).

title: env: added RTX_ENV_FILE config
body: This lets you set RTX_ENV_FILE=.env in order to always import a local env file if one exists.

title: node: remove node-build support
body:
See #1028

Use asdf-nodejs if you want to continue using node-build (but please lmk
why you need it)

title: make --cd a global flag
body: Fixes #977

title: task: read RTX_TASK_OUTPUT as lowercase
body: Fixes #1287

title: plugins: add support for "trusted" plugins
body: see https://github.com/rtx-plugins for more on how this works

title: docs: correct env variable RTX_EXPERIMENTAL in README
body:
RTX_EXPERIMENTAL=1 setting this in .rtx.toml fails with:

```bash
rtx expected value of env.RTX_EXPERIMENTAL to be a string or bool, got: 1
rtx Run with --verbose or RTX_VERBOSE=1 for more information

```

title: Fix typo of where plugin is defined
docs: fix typo in README link
not-found handler
body: Fixes #1266

title: config: simplify loading
body:
Moved the logic around to simplify the config loading process.
For now this removes the ability to have project local settings.

Fixes #735

title: hook-env: move exit-early logic into function
body: This is no longer needed in the config object

title: shims: do not assume something is a shim
body: Fixes #921

title: perf: skip loading config object before launching command
body:
Fixes #412

This makes rtx a lot faster when the config isn't needed—though sadly it _is_ needed for most things. It makes `rtx completion zsh` go from 3ms to 2ms on my machine though.

This paves the way for more perf improvements later. It'll also make things like `rtx doctor` work even if config loading fails.

title: style: use consistent colors for tools/plugins
